Title: Antelope
Materials: Oil on Canvas with painted metal frame
Description: Antelope skull on desert floor.  Ground view point.  Frame painted as part of image.
Credit Line: This purchase made possible by previous donations from Sandy Scott and the Widener Charitable Limited Partnership, with additional assistance from Adrienne and John Mars, Anne and John Marion, Ann and Richard O’Leary, Chuck D. Miller, Peggy and Lowry Mays

Title: In the Clouds
Collector: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
Description: Big horn sheep standing in a pack on a steep mountain side.  The sheep are all looking over to the viewers right.  There are clouds in the background.
Credit Line: JKM Collection, National Museum of Wildlife Art
How Acquired?: RSGBK Lease Agreement; then Museum Purchase
Acqstn Terms: This work is part of the Bill of Sale and Lease Agreement between Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation and the National Museum of Wildlife Art dated March 27, 2009. See RSGBK Donor file for complete list of works. The item transferred from a Robert S.
Acqstn Sources: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation; Richard P. Mellon

Title: Reaching Jaguar
Collector: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
Description: IO and hard file reviewed - 11-2008.  Jaguar climbing down rock outcropping.  Based on studies of Senor Lopez, a jaguar from Paraguay that was the first feline occupant of the Lion House at the Bronx Zoo.
Credit Line: JKM Collection, National Museum of Wildlife Art
Owner: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
Acqstn Note: Purchase price is for the pair (2003.110.001 and  2003.110.002)
Acqstn Sources: Christie's, 360 North Camden Dr., Beverly Hills, CA 90210, (318) 385-2600
Note: Hi-Res Scan located: I:\Curatorial Images\High Res Collections Images\H\Hyatt

Title: Settled for the Night (American Wigeons)
Collector: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
Description: A pack of wigeons sit on small muddy islands in a lake.  Grass grows out of the water.  The sun is setting and the golden reflection glows on the surface of the water.
Credit Line: JKM Collection, National Museum of Wildlife Art
Owner: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
Acqstn Sources: Gerald Peters Gallery, 1011 Paseo De Peralta, Santa Fe, NM 87501, (505) 954-5700, FAX (505) 954-5754

Title: The Refuge
Collector: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
Description: Long, horizontal painting of the elk refuge in winter.  The open fields and mountains are covered in snow and the refuge is filled with elk.
Credit Line: JKM Collection, National Museum of Wildlife Art
How Acquired?: RSGBK Lease Agreement; then Museum Purchase
Acqstn Terms: This work is part of the Bill of Sale and Lease Agreement between Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation and the National Museum of Wildlife Art dated March 27, 2009. See RSGBK Donor file for complete list of works. The item transferred from a Robert S.

Title: Benjamin's Emblem
Materials: Etching, Aquatint, and Drypoint on Paper
Credit Line: Gift of the 2009 and 2010 Collectors Circles, National Museum of Wildlife Art

Title: Waiting for Sockeye
Description: Sculpture of a bear lying on its stomach on a rock.
Credit Line: Generously sponsored by Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Greene and Trailside Galleries, National Museum of Wildlife Art
